required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ertapenem for Initial Empirical Treatment of Third Generation Cephalosporin Resistant Enterobacteriaceae Bacteremia
clinical_study.official_title: Ertapenem for Initial Empirical Treatment of Third Generation Cephalosporin Resistant Enterobacteriaceae Bacteremia: a Propensity Score Analysis

lead_sponsor.agency: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Phramongkutklao College of Medicine and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to assess whether ertapenem as an empiric treatment of third-generation-cephalosporin resistant Enterobacteriaceae (3GCRE) bacteremia is non-inferior to other carbapenems in term of 30-day mortality.

detailed_description.textblock: There are limited data of the efficacy of ertapenem as the empiric treatment of serious invasive infections, such as bloodstream infections (BSIs), that are due to ESBL-producing Enterobacteriaceae. Previous studies of ertapenem were done in small group of patients, in less invasive infection, as a definite 'step-down' therapy, or as compared to other non-carbapenem antibiotics.

primary_outcome.description: death from any cause within 30 days after the blood culture with bacteraemia is drawn

secondary_outcome.description: death from any cause within the duration of admission with bacteraemia
death from any cause within 14 days after the blood culture with bacteraemia is drawn
death from any cause within 90 days after the blood culture with bacteraemia is drawn

arm_group.description: Patients who received ertapenem as an empirical antibiotic
Patients who received carbapenems other than ertapenem as an empirical antibiotic

study_pop.textblock: Patients 18 years of age and older admitted to Phramongkutklao Hospital, and Ananda Mahidol Hospital with 3GCRE monomicrobial bacteremia will be prospectively identified. In given a patient, only the initial episode of 3GCRE monomicrobial bacteremia during the study period will be included.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults, either sex, ages 18 years or above
- Patients with 3GCRE bacteremia
- Patients admitted to any of the study sites
Exclusion Criteria:
- Discontinuation of antibiotic due to transition to hospice care
- Polymicrobial bacteremia
- Empirical antibiotic after 24 hours of first evidence of bacteremia
